snippet: Cultural shifts and economic factors are keeping millennial women home in numbers not seen since 1940, an analysis of Census Bureau data suggests.
abstract: Pew Research Center analysis of Census Bureau data finds that number of young women living at home with parents or relatives is highest since statistics began being tracked in 1940s; among factors cited for rise are later marriage ages, student debt and high rents.
lead_paragraph: Cultural shifts and economic factors are keeping millennial women home in numbers not seen since 1940, an analysis of Census Bureau data suggests.

headline.main: More Young Women Waiting to Leave Home
headline.print_headline: More Young Women Waiting to Leave Home, Analysis of Census Data Suggests
